alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 05 at 2:07PM AKDT until July 06 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, 224, 225 AND 226... Potential for abundant lightning continues in the forecast area with the thermal trough lying from the AlCan Border Crossing to Anaktuvuk Pass this afternoon, and from the AlCan Border Crossing to just east of Arctic Village Wednesday. The thermal trough will rotate to the west and northwest Thursday. Potential for 3000 to 5000 lightning strokes a day through Friday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT FOR LIGHTNING FOR EASTERN ALASKA RANGE... * AFFECTED AREA...Eastern Alaska Range. * TIMING...Until Midnight tonight. * LIGHTNING ACTIVITY LEVEL...4. * WINDS...North 5 to 10 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 35 percent. * TEMPERATURES...71 to 78. * IMPACTS...Ample lightning could lead to numerous new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
